title: Add Admin panel with course management, announcements, lessons, VIP access, and member viewing

requirements.text: Create an Admin page route (/admin) accessible after login that serves as the admin panel dashboard

quotes: Your Admin panel can allow you to

acceptanceCriteria: A new /admin route is registered in App.tsx router configuration
The Admin page is only accessible when a user is authenticated via Internet Identity
The page displays a dashboard layout with navigation to admin features

requirements.text: Add course content editing functionality allowing admins to modify unit titles, descriptions, and topics for all 4 course units
acceptanceCriteria: Backend stores course unit data (title, description, topics) persistently
Backend exposes methods to retrieve and update course unit information
Admin panel displays an editable interface for all 4 units with form inputs
Changes are saved to the backend and reflected on the Course page immediately

requirements.text: Add announcement posting functionality allowing admins to create and publish announcements with title, content, and timestamp
acceptanceCriteria: Backend stores announcements with title, content, author, and timestamp
Backend exposes methods to create, retrieve, and delete announcements
Admin panel includes a form to compose and publish new announcements
Announcements are displayed on the Home page in a dedicated section

requirements.text: Add lesson upload functionality allowing admins to upload new lessons with title, content, associated unit, and order
acceptanceCriteria: Backend stores lessons with title, content, unit ID, order/sequence number, and creation timestamp
Backend exposes methods to create, retrieve, update, and delete lessons
Admin panel provides a form to create new lessons and associate them with units
Lessons can be ordered/sequenced within their respective units

requirements.text: Add VIP access management functionality allowing admins to grant or revoke VIP status for users by principal ID
acceptanceCriteria: Backend stores VIP membership status per principal ID with grant/expiry dates
Backend exposes methods to grant VIP access, revoke access, and check VIP status
Admin panel displays a VIP management interface with user search by principal
Admins can grant or revoke VIP access with confirmation

requirements.text: Add member viewing functionality allowing admins to see a list of all registered users with their principal IDs and join dates
acceptanceCriteria: Backend tracks user registrations with principal ID and join timestamp
Backend exposes a method to retrieve all registered members (admin-only)
Admin panel displays a members list table with principal ID, join date, and VIP status
The list supports pagination or scrolling for large member counts

requirements.text: Implement role-based access control to restrict admin panel access to designated admin principals only
acceptanceCriteria: Backend maintains a list of admin principal IDs
All admin-only methods verify the caller is in the admin list before executing
Non-admin users receive an authorization error when attempting admin operations
The admin list can be initialized with at least one admin principal

constraints: Use the existing Internet Identity authentication system for admin login verification
Maintain single-actor architecture with all Motoko logic in backend/main.mo
Do not modify immutable frontend paths: useInternetIdentity.ts, useInternetIdentity.tsx, useActor.ts, main.tsx, components/ui
Use React Query for all data fetching and mutations in admin features
nonGoals: Advanced lesson content editors (rich text, code highlighting)
Email or push notification system for announcements
